jadacz.lib
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  jadacz.lib.Connection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class Connection
extends Object
implements Closeable

Connection is a class used to handle two way comunication and data exchange. The entity of data transfer is Packet.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Szymon 'tecku' Kordyaczny
See Also:
Packet

Field Summary
protected  DataInputStream in
          Data input stream of connection.
protected  DataOutputStream out
          Data output stream of connection.
protected  Socket socket
          The socket of Connection on local machine.

Connection(Socket socket)
          Creates connection from socket, which means it opens i/o streams.

Constructor Detail

Connection

public Connection(Socket socket)
           throws IOException
Creates connection from socket, which means it opens i/o streams.

Parameters:
socket - the local socket
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs when (data) input/output stream is opening.
Method Detail

send

public void send(Packet packet)
          throws IOException
Sends a packet to output stream of connection. This method is synchronized so more that one thread can call this method without risk of data mix.

Parameters:
packet - the packet to send
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

receive

public void receive(Packet packet)
             throws IOException
Sends a packet to output stream of connection. This method is synchronized so more that one thread can call this method without risk of data mix.

Parameters:
packet - the packet to which write the recivied data
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes input, output stream and socket of the connection. This method simply performs in.close(), out.close() and socket.close().

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs when closing socket, input/output stream
See Also:
FilterInputStream.close(), FilterOutputStream.close(), Socket.close()

getIP

public String getIP()
Gets connection ip number.

Returns:
ip number as String
